New Records: Georgia, ranked 74, defeated Portugal, ranked 6, in the biggest shock of Euro 2024 by FIFA world rankings
Key Match Events: Georgia scored an early goal through Khvicha Kvaratskhelia
Georges Mikautadze converted a second-half penalty
Cristiano Ronaldo was substituted at halftime with only a booking
Ronaldo was frustrated with a penalty decision and later kicked a water bottle
Post-Match Reflections: Portugal will face Slovenia in the round of 16
Georgia's victory means they finish third in Group F
Georgia's manager Willy Sagnol emphasized playing with ambition
Miscellaneous Highlights: Giorgi Mamardashvili, Georgia's highly-rated goalkeeper, made several key saves
Georgia's young players, like Georges Mikautadze, showed potential
Football is growing in popularity in Georgia
